==Events==
*[[539 BC]] &ndash; [[Cyrus the Great]] marches into the city of [[Babylon]], releasing the [[Jews]] from almost [[Babylonian captivity|70 years of exile]]. Cyrus allows the Jews to return to [[Yehud Medinata]] and [[Second Temple|rebuild the Temple]] in [[Jerusalem]].
* [[456]] &ndash; Battle of Placentia: [[Ricimer]], supported by [[Majorian]] (''[[Domesticus (Roman Empire)|comes domesticorum]]''), defeats the Roman usurper [[Avitus]] near [[Piacenza]] ([[Northern Italy]]) .
*[[1091]] &ndash; [[London Tornado of 1091]]: A [[tornado]] thought to be of strength T8/F4 strikes the heart of [[London]].
*[[1346]] &ndash; [[Battle of Neville's Cross]]: King [[David II of Scotland]] is captured by the English near [[Durham]], and imprisoned in the [[Tower of London]] for eleven years.
*[[1448]] &ndash; [[Battle of Kosovo (1448)|Second Battle of Kosovo]], where the mainly [[Hungary|Hungarian]] army led by [[John Hunyadi]] is defeated by an [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] army led by Sultan [[Murad II]].
*[[1456]] &ndash; The [[University of Greifswald]] is established, making it the second oldest university in [[northern Europe]] (also for a period the oldest in [[Sweden]], and [[Prussia]]).
*[[1558]] &ndash; [[Poczta Polska]], the Polish postal service, [[Postage stamps and postal history of Poland|is founded]].
*[[1604]] &ndash; [[SN 1604|Kepler's Star]]: [[Germany|German]] [[astronomer]] [[Johannes Kepler]] observes a [[supernova]] in the [[constellation]] [[Ophiuchus]].
*[[1610]] &ndash; French king [[Louis XIII]] is crowned in [[Rheims]].
*[[1660]] &ndash; [[List of regicides of Charles I|Nine regicide]]s, the men who signed the death warrant of [[Charles I of England|Charles I]], are [[hanged, drawn and quartered]].
*[[1662]] &ndash; [[Charles II of England]] sells [[Dunkirk]] to France for 40,000 pounds.
*[[1771]] &ndash; Premiere in Milan of the opera ''[[Ascanio in Alba]]'', composed by [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart]], age 15.
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: British General [[John Burgoyne]] surrenders his army [[Saratoga campaign|at Saratoga, New York]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: British General [[Charles Cornwallis, 1st Marquess Cornwallis|Lord Charles Cornwallis]] surrenders at the [[Siege of Yorktown]].
*[[1800]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Britain]] takes control of the Dutch colony of [[Curaçao]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; Former leader of the [[Haitian Revolution]], [[Emperor]] [[Jean-Jacques Dessalines|Jacques I]] of [[Haiti]] is [[assassination|assassin]]ated after an oppressive rule.
*[[1860]] &ndash; First [[The Open Championship]] (referred to in North America as the ''British Open'').
*[[1861]] &ndash; 19 people are killed in the [[Cullin-La-Ringo massacre]], the deadliest massacre of Europeans by [[Australian Aborigines|aborigines]] in Australian history.
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[Thomas Edison]] files a patent for the Optical Phonograph (the first movie).
*[[1905]] &ndash; The [[October Manifesto]] issued by Tsar [[Nicholas II of Russia]]
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Guglielmo Marconi]]'s company begins the first commercial transatlantic [[wireless]] service between [[Glace Bay, Nova Scotia]], [[Canada]] and [[Clifden]], [[Ireland]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Bulgaria]], [[Greece]] and [[Serbia]] declare war on the [[Ottoman Empire]], joining [[Montenegro]] in the [[First Balkan War]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; First British bombing of [[Germany]] in [[World War I]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[RCA]] is incorporated as the Radio Corporation of America.
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[Al Capone]] convicted of [[income tax]] [[tax evasion|evasion]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Albert Einstein]] flees [[Nazi Germany]] and moves to the United States.
*[[1941]] &ndash; For the first time in [[World War II]], a German [[submarine]] attacks an American ship.
*  1941   &ndash; German troops [[War crimes of the Wehrmacht#Reprisal actions|execute]] the male population of the villages Kerdyllia in [[Serres]], [[Greece]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Burma Railway]] (Burma-Thailand Railway) is completed.
*  1943   &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: [[Sobibor extermination camp]] is closed.
*[[1945]] &ndash; A massive number of people, headed by [[Confederación General del Trabajo de la República Argentina|CGT]], gather in the [[Plaza de Mayo]] in [[Argentina]] to demand [[Juan Peron]]'s release. It calls "el día de la lealtad peronista" ([[Loyalty Day (Argentina)|peronista loyalty day]])
*  1945   &ndash; [[Archbishop Damaskinos of Athens]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Greece]] between the pull-out of the German occupation force in 1944 and the return of [[George II of Greece|King Georgios II]] to Greece.
*[[1956]] &ndash; The first commercial [[Nuclear reactor technology|nuclear power station]] is officially opened by [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]] in [[Sellafield]],in [[Cumbria]], [[England]].
*  1956   &ndash; [[Donald Byrne]] and [[Bobby Fischer]] play a famous chess game called [[The Game of the Century (chess)|The Game of the Century]]. Fischer beat Byrne and wins a Brilliancy prize.
*[[1961]] &ndash; Scores of [[Algeria]]n protesters (some claim up to 400) are [[Paris massacre of 1961|massacred]] by the [[Paris]] police at the instigation of former [[Nazi]] collaborator [[Maurice Papon]], then chief of the [[Prefecture of Police]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Prime Minister of Australia]] [[Robert Menzies]] opens the artificial [[Lake Burley Griffin]] in the middle of the capital [[Canberra]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[1964 New York World's Fair|1964-1965 New York World's Fair]] closes after a two year run. More than 51 million people had attended the two-year event.
*[[1966]] &ndash; A fire at a building in [[New York City]] kills 12 firefighters, the [[New York City Fire Department|fire department]]'s deadliest day until the [[September 11, 2001 attacks]].
*  1966   &ndash; [[Botswana]] and [[Lesotho]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Montreal, Quebec]]: Quebec [[Premier|Vice-Premier]] and Minister of Labour [[Pierre Laporte]] murdered by members of the [[FLQ]] terrorist group.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[OPEC]] starts an [[petroleum|oil]] embargo against a number of western countries, considered to have helped [[Israel]] in its war against [[Syria]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[German Autumn]]: Four days after it is [[Aircraft hijacking|hijacked]], [[Lufthansa]] [[Lufthansa Flight 181|Flight 181]] lands in [[Mogadishu]], [[Somalia]], where a team of [[Germany|German]] [[GSG 9]] [[commandos]] later rescues all remaining [[hostage]]s on board.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Mother Teresa]] awarded the [[Nobel Peace Prize]].
*  1979   &ndash; The [[Department of Education Organization Act]] is signed into law creating the [[US Department of Education]] and [[US Department of Health and Human Services]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; As part of the [[Holy See – United Kingdom relations]] a British monarch makes the first state visit to the Vatican
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[1989 Loma Prieta earthquake]] (7.1 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]]) hits the [[San Francisco Bay Area]] and causes 57 deaths directly (and 6 indirectly).
*[[1992]] &ndash; Having gone to the wrong house for a Halloween party, Japanese [[exchange student]] [[Yoshihiro Hattori]] is shot and killed by the homeowner in [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; Russian journalist [[Dmitry Kholodov]] is assassinated while investigating corruption in the armed forces.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Hatfield rail crash|Train crash]] at [[Hatfield, Hertfordshire|Hatfield]], north of London, leading to collapse of [[Railtrack]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; Israeli tourism minister [[Rehavam Ze'evi]] became the first Israeli minister to be [[Assassination of Rehavam Ze'evi|assassinated]] in a terrorist attack.
*[[2003]] &ndash; The pinnacle is fitted on the roof of [[Taipei 101]], a 101-floor [[skyscraper]] in [[Taipei]], allowing it to surpass the [[Petronas Twin Towers]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]] by {{convert|56|m|sigfig=3}} and become the [[World's tallest structures|world's tallest highrise]].
